metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: JavaScript Where To
The <script> Tag
In HTML, JavaScript code is inserted between <script> and </script> tags.
content.html: In HTML, JavaScript code is inserted between <script> and </script> tags.

content.code_html:
<script>
document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = "My First JavaScript";
</script>

content.text: Old JavaScript examples may use a type attribute: <script type="text/javascript">. The type attribute is not required. JavaScript is the default scripting language in HTML.
content.html:
Old JavaScript examples may use a type attribute: <script type="text/javascript">.
The type attribute is not required. JavaScript is the default scripting language in HTML.

content.text: JavaScript Functions and Events
A JavaScript function is a block of JavaScript code, that can be executed when "called" for.
content.html: A JavaScript function is a block of JavaScript code, that can be executed when "called" for.

content.text: For example, a function can be called when an event occurs, like when the user clicks a button.
content.html: For example, a function can be called when an event occurs, like when the user clicks a button.

content.text: You will learn much more about functions and events in later chapters.
content.html: You will learn much more about functions and events in later chapters.

content.text: JavaScript in <head> or <body>
You can place any number of scripts in an HTML document.
content.html: You can place any number of scripts in an HTML document.

content.text: Scripts can be placed in the <body> , or in the <head> section of an HTML page, or in both.
content.html: Scripts can be placed in the <body>, or in the <head> section of an HTML page, or in both.

content.text: JavaScript in <head>
In this example, a JavaScript function is placed in the <head> section of an HTML page.
content.html: In this example, a JavaScript function is placed in the <head> section of an HTML page.

content.text: The function is invoked (called) when a button is clicked:
content.html: The function is invoked (called) when a button is clicked:

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
<script>
function myFunction() {
  document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = "Paragraph changed.";
}
</script>
</head>
<body>

<h2>Demo JavaScript in Head</h2>

<p id="demo">A Paragraph</p>
<button type="button" onclick="myFunction()">Try it</button>

</body>
</html>

content.text: JavaScript in <body>
In this example, a JavaScript function is placed in the <body> section of an HTML page.
content.html: In this example, a JavaScript function is placed in the <body> section of an HTML page.

content.text: The function is invoked (called) when a button is clicked:
content.html: The function is invoked (called) when a button is clicked:

content.code:
Demo JavaScript in Body

A Paragraph
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>

<h2>Demo JavaScript in Body</h2>

<p id="demo">A Paragraph</p>

<button type="button" onclick="myFunction()">Try it</button>

<script>
function myFunction() {
  document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = "Paragraph changed.";
}
</script>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Placing scripts at the bottom of the <body> element improves the display speed, because script interpretation slows down the display.
content.html: Placing scripts at the bottom of the <body> element improves the display speed, because script interpretation slows down the display.

content.text: External JavaScript
Scripts can also be placed in external files:
content.html: Scripts can also be placed in external files:

content.code_html:
function myFunction() {
  document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = "Paragraph changed.";
}

content.text: External scripts are practical when the same code is used in many different web pages.
content.html: External scripts are practical when the same code is used in many different web pages.

content.text: JavaScript files have the file extension .js .
content.html: JavaScript files have the file extension .js.

content.text: To use an external script, put the name of the script file in the src (source) attribute of a <script> tag:
content.html: To use an external script, put the name of the script file in the src (source) attribute of a <script> tag:

content.code_html: <script src="myScript.js"></script>

content.text: You can place an external script reference in <head> or <body> as you like.
content.html: You can place an external script reference in <head> or <body> as you like.

content.text: The script will behave as if it was located exactly where the <script> tag is located.
content.html: The script will behave as if it was located exactly where the <script> tag is located.

content.text: External scripts cannot contain <script> tags.
content.html: External scripts cannot contain <script> tags.

content.text: External JavaScript Advantages
Placing scripts in external files has some advantages:
content.html: Placing scripts in external files has some advantages:

content.text: To add several script files to one page - use several script tags:
content.html: To add several script files to one page  - use several script tags:

content.code_html:
<script src="myScript1.js"></script>
<script src="myScript2.js"></script>

content.text: External References
An external script can be referenced in 3 different ways:
content.html: An external script can be referenced in 3 different ways:

content.text: This example uses a full URL to link to myScript.js:
content.html: This example uses a full URL to link to myScript.js:

content.code_html: <script src="https://www.w3schools.com/js/myScript.js"></script>

content.text: This example uses a file path to link to myScript.js:
content.html: This example uses a file path to link to myScript.js:

content.code_html: <script src="/js/myScript.js"></script>

content.text: This example uses no path to link to myScript.js:
content.html: This example uses no path to link to myScript.js:

content.code_html: <script src="myScript.js"></script>

content.text: You can read more about file paths in the chapter HTML File Paths .
content.html: You can read more about file paths in the chapter HTML File Paths.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
In HTML, JavaScripts must be inserted inside which HTML tags?
content.html: In HTML, JavaScripts must be inserted inside which HTML tags?
